newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore noon stocks retreat, electronics firm.
newsitem.headline: Singapore noon stocks retreat, electronics firm.

text.p: Singapore shares remained weak on Thursday morning following Wall Street's plunge overnight.
The Straits Times Industrials Index fell 10.68 to 2,057.45.
Selected electronics stocks continued to receive a boost from the eight percent rise in first quarter U.S. factory sales of electronics equipment, components and related products, dealers said.

The Electronic Industries Association, representing U.S. electronics makers, reported sales rose to about US$107 billion on May 6. The SES electronics index was firm at 129.28, up 0.91 percent, or 1.17 points.

Creative Technologies led the gainers, up Singapore $1.00 to S$25.90. Uraco edged up S$0.03 to S$0.87 after it reassured shareholders it was not affected by charges of possible fraud at CAM International, in which it has a 6.5 percent stake.
Aztech Systems rose S$0.025 to S$0.60 on an active 4.3 million shares.
Property and banking stocks took a breather from recent gains. Foreign tranches of DBS, UOB, OCBC along with SIA Foreign and City Developments eased as well.
